paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Gly103Arg variant in the TTR gene, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual case reports.

patients.demographics: Mean age 39.1 ± 4.27 years, 21 males and 23 females, all from China
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with symptoms including blurred vision, vitreous opacity, and peripheral neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Severe peripheral neuropathy, blurred vision, vitreous opacity
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was a 48-year-old male diagnosed with ATTRv due to the Gly103Arg variant, who had severe peripheral neuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: History of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband’s mother (II-6), maternal uncle (II-9), and eldest brother (III-1) had a history of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness.

individual_records.phenotype_details: History of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband’s mother (II-6), maternal uncle (II-9), and eldest brother (III-1) had a history of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness.

individual_records.phenotype_details: History of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband’s mother (II-6), maternal uncle (II-9), and eldest brother (III-1) had a history of vitreous opacity and lower extremity weakness.
His niece (IV-1) did not have any symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The Gly103Arg variant leads to instability in the TTR protein structure, causing amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The Gly103Arg variant is unique to the Chinese population, frequently occurring in southern China.
key_quotes: The Gly103Arg variant is unique to the Chinese population, frequently occurring in southern China.
The initial clinical manifestations were primarily blurred vision, with only one case presenting with numbness of the upper limbs.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
